title: Possible future skin bio groupings
body:
More and more skins are being assimilated into new and interesting alternate universes
There are still a lot of skins without bios and are not part of a shared universe but by looking which skins share common or similar themes it wouldn't be too hard to imagine that these skins could be part of the same universe.

ENCHANTED FOREST
Elderwood Bard 
Elderwood Hecarim 
Elderwood LeBlanc 
Death Blossom Elise 
Death Blossom Kha'Zix
Blackthorn Morgana

MEDIEVAL
Executioner Mundo
Little Knight Amumu 
Sir Kled 
Medieval Twitch
Blacksmith Poppy

FEUDAL JAPAN
Sakura Karma
Samurai Master Yi
Koi Nami 
Warlord Shen
Ninja rammus

DEMON REALM
Gatekeeper Galio 
Little Devil Teemo
Demonblade Tryndamere 
Demon Vi 
Infernal Alistar
Infernal Diana
Infernal Mordekaiser
Infernal Nasus 

WILD WEST
Longhorn Alistar 
Sheriff Caitlyn 
Desperada Cassiopeia 
Bandito Fiddlesticks 
High Noon Jhin 
Cowgirl Miss Fortune 
Sonoran Kog'Maw 
Sandscourge Skarner 
High Noon Twisted Fate 
High Noon Yasuo

DEEP SEA
Atlantean Syndra 
Atlantean Fizz
Deep Sea Nami 
Deep Sea Kog'Maw 
Deep One Kassadin
Deep Terror Thresh
Scuba Gragas

Elemental lords
Ashen Lord Aurelion Sol 
Thunder Lord Ornn 
Thunder Lord Volibear

HOSPITAL 
Nurse Akali 
Kennen M. D. 
Surgeon Shen 

ARABIAN
Djinn Malzahar
Sultan Gangplank
Sultan Tryndamere

also there are a few skins I think can be added to existing universes

guardian of the sands additions
Sandstorm Ekko
Sandstorm Katarina
Sand Wraith Pyke

prehistoric additions
Tribal Ryze
Sabretusk Sejuani 
Huntress Sivir

replies.body: Nightmare {{champion:31}} should totally be a Kaiju skin.

Hello! Skins writer here.

These are awesome! Allow me to shed a little light on your groupings and where they currently stand:

* The Death Blossom/Elderwood skins are _extremely_ popular internally as flavor for new and existing high fantasy universes, so there's a bit of a battle to see where they ultimately end up. People _really_ love these skins.
* The Medieval and Feudal Japan skins are also interesting -- we haven't talked about them much yet, but they could (keyword could) have a lot of potential going forward. They could also end up as their own skinlines without universes -- I'm not sure quite yet.
* Demon Realm is extremely awesome and I can't wait to write the descriptions for that skinset (we probably won't call it Demon Realm, but it'll likely involve demons and/or fire).
* The potential list for Deep Sea skins is even longer than the one you posted, but it's likely we won't get around to it for a few more patches. It's definitely on our radar.
* Wild West exists as High Noon.
* Hospital/Arabian will probably end up as skinlines without universes, unless something drastically changes or they get a Legendary (or they already have a legendary in them and I don't know it yet).

As I understand it, a skinline won't become a Universe unless it's really popular or has a Legendary+ tier skin already in it.

EDIT: Just saw Elemental Lords! Not sure about those guys. I'll tackle them when they show up on my docket.

I just want to say I hope we get bios for some skins, even if they're not part of a skinline.  The ones on my mind are the three Ultimate skins that aren't part of a set (although DJ Sona maybe doesn't need one? You can pretty much take her at face value).  The other thing was that I hope there isn't necessarily a push to put every skin into a shared universe just because it's Legendary+.  I think it's nice for some of them to be champion-specific.

> [{quoted}](name=Larriet,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jM8UoZAg,comment-id=00090001,timestamp=2018-07-10T14:44:34.489+0000)
>
> I just want to say I hope we get bios for some skins, even if they're not part of a skinline.  The ones on my mind are the three Ultimate skins that aren't part of a set (although DJ Sona maybe doesn't need one? You can pretty much take her at face value).  The other thing was that I hope there isn't necessarily a push to put every skin into a shared universe just because it's Legendary+.  I think it's nice for some of them to be champion-specific.

DJ Sona will end up as part of a universe, though I can't say which one yet because I *frantically searching through loose papers* haven't started developing it yet.

As for standalones, those will still exist. Statue of Karthus is the first, I believe, but there are a few others.

Without the context of whatever you haven't started developing yet, DJ Sona feels like she could represent the more civilian side of the PROJECT world - basically a product put out by one of the corporations, like a manufactured pop star.
Uncle Ryze isn't with Statue of Karthus? As 2 American icons, it would make sense to have them in the same universe.
Is Ravenborn Leblanc connected in any way to Tyrant Swain?

Hi Carnival Knights,

I would like to request several skins to be added into specific existing skin sets due to them just perfectly fitting in them. You have already did a great Job by adding Hyena Warwick into the Road Warriors set, as well as Dark Valkyrie Diana in the Fables one, but I do have several other suggestions if you are willing to hear me out.

**Dino Gnar in Toy Box**

This one should be a perfect finisher for the skin set, since the description for the set says:

**_"Gnar's toy chest is brimming with priceless treasures, but when no one's home, his toys take on a life of their own..."_**
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/5/55/Gnar_DinoSkin_HD.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20171026155536

Since Dino Gnars thematic revolves around a kids toys, playrooms, and the Toy Box set stating that the toys are from Gnar, it only fits to add that skin in the set.

**Dragon Knight Mordekaiser in Dragon World**

This one would be added currently because of the name, since the visuals of the skin need update (as well as Mordekaiser in general), but he would be a great addition in Dragon Slayer or Dragon Master sub-sets of the skin theme (Or make him a former Dragonslayer turned Dragon Master like Swain was)

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/6/6d/Mordekaiser_DragonKnightSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170621201036

**Emerald Taric in Elderwood / Enchanted Forest**

This one is no surprise, ever since Tarics Update gave us this amazing new look and artwork where we see Emerald Taric healing the GIANT hant of Elderwood Hecarim. A wood elf dude in an Enchanted Forest theme, it fits.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/2/26/Taric_EmeraldSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170616231647
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/5/59/Hecarim_ElderwoodSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170615212803

**Tribal Ryze in Prehistoric Hunters**

This one is a suggestion for several reasons. One: The new artwork shows Tribal Ryze fighting some Prehistoric Cho Gath looking Dinosaur in the background. And his clothing match the more primal setting.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/c/cf/Ryze_TribalSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170615215409
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/3/3a/Cho%27Gath_PrehistoricSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170616215823

PS: Love that Gnar can be seen in the background next to Prehistoric Renektons tail, thats so cool.

Two: The Olaf vs Everything comic shows Tribal Ryze being part of the same alternate universe as the Beast Hunters when classic Olaf came to their world.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/f/fd/Olaf_OvE_pr07.png/revision/latest?cb=20180509161135
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/0/09/Olaf_OvE_pr08.png/revision/latest?cb=20180509151817



**Other Random Suggestions:**
1. Add Full Metal skins in the PROJECT, Steel Valkiries, or Battlecast skin sets.
2. Combine Cottontail with Bee Keeper/ Beemo skin sets.
3. Combine Riot, Police skins, Mafia, and Secret Agents skins into one giant Cops and Robbers skin set. The Punches and Plants comic is so amazing how it intergrates all of them in one universe that makes sense.
4. Put Immortal Journey in the Lunar Revel skin set.
5. Combine Lost Empire and Guardian of the Sands, Sandstorm, Shuriman, and Arabian looking skins into one giant Shuriman Alternate Universe skin set.
6. Make Marauder and Warden skins part of the Verus skin set, their visual look match nicely with God-King Garen and Darius.
7. Combine Thunder Lord skin theme with Ashen Lord Aurelion Sol, Obsidian Malphite , Elementalist Lux and other similar Elemental skins into one giant Elementalist skin set. Obsidian Malphite even looks like the creature Elementalist Lux fought in her release promo video.
8. Combine Arctic Ops, Omega Squad, Commando, and Special Forces into one giant "Military" skin set.
9. Add Dryad Soraka into the Elderwood / Enchanted Forest skin set along with Emerald Taric. 
10. And if possible see if you could combine Academy with Star Guardian where Academy Ahri and Star Guardian Ahri are the same person, just from different periods in their lives.


Thank you for your time, hopefully you were nice enough to read this Carnival Knights and that Riot were able to implement some of these suggestions into current skin sets and future skin sets.

> [{quoted}](name=Tesla Effect,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jM8UoZAg,comment-id=00090003,timestamp=2018-07-10T21:46:17.512+0000)
>
> Hi Carnival Knights,
> 

I'll comment on the major ones you posted as well as Olaf vs Everything (which is super fun but ENTIRELY NOT CANON). 

Dino Gnar will indeed go into Toy Box, Tribal Ryze will end up in Prehistoric Hunters, and DK Morde is similarly scheduled to end up in Dragon World. Emerald Taric is balancing between two very different skin thematics, so we're looking into which one it will land.

As for Olaf vs Everything, it's probably one of my favorite community collabs we've worked on this year. I used to be on the team that makes it, which does community collabs such as the Helmet Bro Animated Series and Champ Mixes. Thing is... that stuff isn't part of the core canon. They work with community creators to make content that exists outside our canon, so the Olaf vs Everything universe is just a sweet, self contained comic where Olaf kills... everything. I encourage everyone to read it because it rules, but it's not part of our core universe, or "Runeterra Prime" if you will.

The Olaf in the main League IP doesn't really travel across dimensions smashing faces and being mad online. That dude is awesome, but exists only in the world of Olaf VS Everything. Hope that clears up some lingering confusion, hah!

> [{quoted}](name=Carnival Knights,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jM8UoZAg,comment-id=000900030000,timestamp=2018-07-11T01:37:45.287+0000)
>
> I'll comment on the major ones you posted as well as Olaf vs Everything (which is super fun but ENTIRELY NOT CANON). 
> 
> Dino Gnar will indeed go into Toy Box, Tribal Ryze will end up in Prehistoric Hunters, and DK Morde is similarly scheduled to end up in Dragon World. Emerald Taric is balancing between two very different skin thematics, so we're looking into which one it will land.
> 
> As for Olaf vs Everything, it's probably one of my favorite community collabs we've worked on this year. I used to be on the team that makes it, which does community collabs such as the Helmet Bro Animated Series and Champ Mixes. Thing is... that stuff isn't part of the core canon. They work with community creators to make content that exists outside our canon, so the Olaf vs Everything universe is just a sweet, self contained comic where Olaf kills... everything. I encourage everyone to read it because it rules, but it's not part of our core universe, or "Runeterra Prime" if you will.
> 
> The Olaf in the main League IP doesn't really travel across dimensions smashing faces and being mad online. That dude is awesome, but exists only in the world of Olaf VS Everything. Hope that clears up some lingering confusion, hah!

Thank you so much for considering my suggestions, my best wishes is for Riot to make as much of a consistent lore world as possible. This also includes skin alternate universes. 
And Thank you so much for the Olaf vs Everything comic clarifications. It helps a lot when Riot answers these lore conundrums on what is prime canon and whats alternate universe canon. 

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/c/c9/LoL_Facebook_Icon_06.gif/revision/latest?cb=20161029213522

thank you so much for commenting{{sticker:sg-kiko}} 
always good to get riot feedback 
cant wait to read more on the skin bios

EDIT: Also can you tell me whats the general stance on the marauders and wardens cause as I stated in a previous post
they look like they could fit as elite guards for god-king Darius and Garen respectively.

> [{quoted}](name=Xodiathe4bdn1,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jM8UoZAg,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2018-07-10T09:38:49.952+0000)
>
> thank you so much for commenting{{sticker:sg-kiko}} 
> always good to get riot feedback 
> cant wait to read more on the skin bios
> 
> EDIT: Also can you tell me whats the general stance on the marauders and wardens cause as I stated in a previous post
> they look like they could fit as elite guards for god-king Darius and Garen respectively.

Yep yep!

As I understand it, the Marauders and Wardens were designed to pay homage to the original Protectorate and Magelords from the original League canon. Kind of like a nod to the OG lore, with a more modernized style.

What that means for me is that I need to figure out how that world functions, considering there's a shard of the multiverse where a version of those two factions survived. I imagine I'll need to hunt down a lot of the people who wrote the Journal of Justice entries as part of my research.

I can’t speak for everyone, but as someone who likes the old lore, I don’t mind those skins being their own universe.

Have you decided what the crimson elite are? They were originally meant to be lore skins, but I think riot may have moved on from that. Not sure though.

Hi, do you also happen to be the writer of the skin bio for Dark Valkyrie Diana?

>Occasionally, a valkyrie will be seduced by the comforts of mortal life, and be cast out from the halls of Valhalla. Understandably, this makes them pretty upset with Valhalla's whole management style.

If yes, could you please explain what did you mean by "seduced by the comforts of a mortal life" exactly? Many people, myself included, were quite disappointed while reading that, because it made it sound like Diana didn't stray from the herd because of her personal conviction, but for lack of strength of character.

We also expected a certain degree of grandiosity from a mythological-inspired skin line, but the linguistic register used ("pretty upset with Valhalla's whole management style") may have brought it too down to earth, making DV Diana's story sound extremely trivial.

> [{quoted}](name=XIII Vanitas,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jM8UoZAg,comment-id=00090002,timestamp=2018-07-10T15:03:35.359+0000)
>
> Hi, do you also happen to be the writer of the skin bio for Dark Valkyrie Diana?
> 
> If yes, could you please explain what did you mean by "seduced by the comforts of a mortal life" exactly? Many people, myself included, were quite disappointed while reading that, because it made it sound like Diana didn't stray from the herd because of her personal conviction, but for lack of strength of character.
> 
> We also expected a certain degree of grandiosity from a mythological-inspired skin line, but the linguistic register used ("pretty upset with Valhalla's whole management style") may have brought it too down to earth, making DV Diana's story sound extremely trivial.

Sure.

The skins in the Fables set are generally pretty old, and have no coherent backstory. In those cases I tend to go for 'funny' instead of 'serious,' because it's more fun to write and generally appeals to a wider audience for a longer period of time. I understand this doesn't please everyone, but if I committed to deep backstories for every skinline we'd have stuff like The Statue Of Karthus holding extremely developed plot significance in a universe that includes... The Statue of Karthus.

That said, we do a yearly review and see if the descriptions need to be punched up or are too jokey to stick around. If so, we'll change them. But we need to get through the rest of them first, barring some sort of thematic relaunch for a skinline (kind of like how the Mecha line went from Kha'Zix Skin 2 to a whole alternate fantasy). 

Speaking thereof, I'm campaigning internally for a revisit to Fables. If I can convince enough people, you'll be getting that epic, dark fantasy description you want (as will stuff like Muse Sona and Leprechaun Veigar), along with some sort of tangible world description/story. Wish me luck!

Thank you for replying!
I've been a huge fan of ancient myths since I was a little child (partially thanks Greg Street's Age of Mythology, which I used to often play with my dad), so I really hope you succeed.

I don't think they can add Sabretusk Sejuani to Prehistoric, since Beast Hunter is already there.  Although that kind of wracks my brain...

I want to point out that Little Devil Teemo is related to Bewitching {{champion:25}} {{champion:18}} !  They were the ones who summoned him.

I totally thought Sand Wraith {{champion:555}}  looked like a Guardian of the Sand, so I REALLY agree with that one.

> [{quoted}](name=Tesla Effect,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jM8UoZAg,comment-id=000a0001,timestamp=2018-07-10T21:59:11.850+0000)
>

Some skins lines are placed in opposition to each other - like the Program and Project skin lines.  Could the Medieval (which seems to have a sort of chivalrous vibe) be the "good guys" vs the decidedly unfriendly seeming Omen skins?
He's been grouped with that horror-themed line with Iron Inquisitor Kayle, it seems

A couple comments:

1) Sandstorm are, I believe, the same universe as Djinn, which may or may not ALSO be the same universe as Guardians of the Sands. On the other hand, I'm pretty sure Sultan are not part of that universe (or at least, were not intended to be at time of release).

2) Bewitching Morgana / Tristana (and Nidalee?) are the same universe as Lil' Devil Teemo. I'm not sure they are the same as the other Infernal/Demon you listed, their art-style is pretty different, but it sounds like a reasonable grouping.
I think they should lump Ashen Lord Aurelion Sol in with Scorched Earth Xerath and Renekton

your wild west is currently labled high noon in the skin bio but has all those skins and I think you should add lord mordekaiser (basically thunder lord) to your elemental lord skin set. All in all nice list
Lord Mordekaiser is a Chaos Lord. Dunno what you're talking about.

> Chaos Lord

According to the boards, the correct term is "edgelord".
[No, he's a Chaos Lord.](http://warhammer40k.wikia.com/wiki/Araghast_the_Pillager)
